New Records: The Cubs have racked up 98 hits, 80 runs, 43 extra-base hits, 18 stolen bases and 14 home runs in their last 8 games, a feat never before seen in MLB history.
Key Match Events: The Cubs won 7 out of their last 8 games, with their only loss being a fluky 7-2 defeat to the Miami Marlins.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were 3 games over.500 and in second place in the NL Central, 10 games back of the Milwaukee Brewers.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs' offense has been firing on all cylinders, hitting, hitting for power, and being aggressive on the bases.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ian Happ has led the charge for Chicago, batting.400/.475/.686 with 14 hits, including 7 doubles, over the last 8 games.
Others: The Cubs are five games behind the Atlanta Braves for the third NL Wild Card spot and just two games behind the New York Mets.
